intro: Onosma bulbotricha, commonly known as the bulbous thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its bulbous root system allows it to store water, enabling survival in harsh conditions. Onosma bulbotricha is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
